MEMORANDUM
May 21, 1957
TO: Members of NAEB-ETRC Liaison Committee
CC: Harry Jo Skornia
PROM: Burton Paulu
In the paragraphs below I have tried to set down what seem
to me the things agreed upon in our meeting with Harry Newburn
In Ann Arbor on May l!j.0
10 Though no formal action was taken, I believe there was a
consensus of opinion that this committee might better be referred
to as the NAEB«ETRC Liaison Committee than to continue under Its
present title of Advisory Committee to the President of the ETRC*
Since Newburn clearly does not seek advice from us. It seems
presumptuous that we should designate ourselves to provide him
with somei Therefore, I suggest that in the future we refer to
ourselve.s as the NAEB«ETRC Liaison Committee*
2* There seemed to be agreement among us of HA SB that the
continuance of such a committee Is necessary. There is not only
the question, of relationships between HAEB and the Center in the
matter of television, but there also are the radio activities of
the two groups, as well as the jurisdiction of the NAEB and the
ETRC in such matters as funds for In^training which we discussed
at our meeting on Tuesday®
3a There would also seem to be agreement on the need for
some kind of committee to represent the affiliates in their
relationships with the Center, particularly as a way to channel
their ideas and complaints to the Center. Such a committee might
be one set up by the Center itself; it-might be a committee set
up by the affiliates; or it m*gjht be an NAEB committee appointed
by me, with the advice, consent and approval of the affiliates, to
represent them In this liaison capacity* However, Newburn*s ^
statements at our meeting, taken together with the-. Sunday night
and Monday noon sessions of the affiliates In the absence 'of any
representatives of the Center, would seem to indicate the need
for such a group®
1*. The principal question in this would seem to be whether this
new affiliates~ETRC Liaison Committee should be the present NAT2B-
ETRC Committee; a separate NAEB committee; a committee set up by
the affiliates acting apart from NAEB; or one set up by Newburnc
Involved here, of course, is the whole question of whether NAEB
con easily and properly represent the affiliates in this matter.
It would seem to me that these and related matters should
be explored at and in connection with the television management
seminar which we will hold at A Her ton House in August®
